etymologies: late Middle English (denoting the ancient Greek drachma): from Old French dragme or late Latin dragma, via Latin from Greek drakhmē (see drachma)

definitions: a unit of weight formerly used by apothecaries, equivalent to 60 grains or one eighth of an ounce.
shortDefinitions: unit of weight formerly used by apothecaries

definitions: a liquid measure formerly used by apothecaries, equivalent to 60 minims or one eighth of a fluid ounce.
shortDefinitions: liquid measure formerly used by apothecaries

definitions: an ancient silver coin based on the Attic or Hellenistic drachma.
